sentences.sContent: Always lock your bicycle to something secure.
sentences.sCn: 每次都要把自行车锁在牢固的物体上。

sentences.sContent: She’d always assumed that Gabriel was a girl’s name.
sentences.sCn: 她一直认为加布里埃尔是个女孩名字。

sentences.sContent: He hadn’t always been a butler.
...He had always had a good memory...
...Some scholars think teamwork may not always be reliable...
...Teams are not always the answer—teams may provide insight...
...it was always known that the body accumulates damage...
...They are always polite and rational people...
...There are people who always wait until the last minute...

...We are suffering, he writes, from a "serendipity deficit." The word "serendipity" was coined by Horace Walpole in an 1854 letter from a tale of three princes whowere always making discoveries by accident...
...I will always remember your kindness and painstaking labor...

trans.tranOther: all the time, at all times, or every time
